edits.label: Update /workspaces/coarch/packages/sample/src/image.coarch.md
edits.text:
---
title: Image Resize Command Line Application
description: Develop a command line app for resizing images using Node.js LTS, optimal algorithms, and validation techniques.
keywords:
  - image resize
  - command line app
  - Node.js
  - image processing
  - resizing algorithm
---

# Image Resize

A command line app that resizes images using the best algorithm. Use Node.js LTS.

* [node](./image.mjs)
- [genfiles.node/image.mjs](./genfiles.node/image.mjs)

## Parse Command Line Arguments {#UV61}
Extract file name, size, and output file name.

## Validate Input {#QY23}
Check arguments, input file, dimensions, and output file name.

## Load Image {#MD29}
Load the image using a library.

## Determine Optimal Algorithm {#KU58}
Select the best resizing algorithm.

## Resize Image {#OR24}
Resize the image to the specified size.

## Save Resized Image {#IA42}
Save the resized image to the output file name.

## Display Success Message {#DT13}
Inform the user of the completed process and output file name.

response.trace:
# Prompt trace



## Prompt template "Technical proofreading" (`technical`)

```````````````js
  1: prompt({
  2:     title: "Technical proofreading",
  3:     description: "Review the text as a technical document writer.",
  4:     categories: ["samples"],
  5:     system: ["system.technical", "system.summary"],
  6:     temperature: 0
  7: })
  8: 
  9: $`You are reviewing and updating TEXT to fix grammatical errors, fix spelling errors and make it technical.`
 10: 
 11: def("TEXT", env.file)
 12: 
```````````````



## Inline prompts

Added as comment at the end of a fragment: 

```markdown
Lorem ipsum...

<!-- @prompt.NAME 
You are concise.
!-->
```
        

-   **@prompt** missing
-   **@prompt.samples** missing


## console output
> tip: use `console.log()` from prompt.js files
## Expanded prompt

```````````````markdown
You are reviewing and updating TEXT to fix grammatical errors, fix spelling errors and make it technical.

TEXT:
````` file=/workspaces/coarch/packages/sample/src/image.coarch.md
---
title: Image Resize Command Line Application
description: Develop a command line app for resizing images using Node.js LTS, optimal algorithms, and validation techniques.
keywords:
  - image resize
  - command line app
  - Node.js
  - image processing
  - resizing algorithm
---

# Image resize

A command line app that resizes images using the best algorithm. Use node.js LTS.

* [node](./image.mjs)
- [genfiles.node/image.mjs](./genfiles.node/image.mjs)

## Parse command line arguments {#UV61}
Extract file name, size, and output file name.

## Validate Input {#QY23}
Check arguments, input file, dimensions, and output file name.

## Load image {#MD29}
Load the image using a library.

## Determine Optimal Algorithm {#KU58}
Select the best resizing algorithm.

## Resize image {#OR24}
Resize the image to the specified size.

## Save resized image {#IA42}
Save the resized image to the output file name.

## Display success message {#DT13}
Inform the user of the completed process and output file name.
`````
```````````````


## Variables
Variables are referenced through `env.NAME` in prompts.

-   env.**error**: `ERROR-QORIFT`

-   env.**links**
```````````````js
[ { label: "node",
  filename: "src/image.mjs",
  content: "import fs from 'fs';\nimport path from 'path';\nimport sharp f"... },
{ label: "genfiles.node/image.mjs",
  filename: "src/genfiles.node/image.mjs",
  content: "import fs from 'fs';\nimport path from 'path';\nimport sharp f"... } ]
```````````````

-   env.**parents**
```````````````js
[  ]
```````````````

-   env.**fence**
```````````````
`````
```````````````

-   env.**promptOptions**
```````````````js
{  }
```````````````

-   env.**vars**
```````````````js
{  }
```````````````

-   env.**templates**
```````````````js
[ { id: "feature",
  title: "Generate BDD scenarios (.feature)",
  description: "Generate a Gherkin feature file from the node and children." },
{ id: "genfiles.node",
  title: "Generate Node.js Code (multifile)",
  description: undefined },
{ id: "gen-structure",
  title: "Generate Project Structure",
  description: "Generate project structure." },
{ id: "python",
  title: "Generate Python Code",
  description: undefined },
{ id: "shorten.3.5",
  title: "Shorten 3.5",
  description: "Shorten the summary of the fragment using cheaper model." },
{ id: "short and summarize_2",
  title: "Shorten and Summarize",
  description: "Shorten the summary of the fragment." },
{ id: "shorten",
  title: "Shorten",
  description: "Shorten the summary of the fragment." },
{ id: "summarize-links",
  title: "Summarize links",
  description: "Expands contents from links and summarizes them" },
{ id: "front-matter",
  title: "Title and Description",
  description: undefined },
{ id: "technical",
  title: "Technical proofreading",
  description: "Review the text as a technical document writer." } ]
```````````````

-   env.**file**
```````````````js
{ filename: "/workspaces/coarch/packages/sample/src/image.coarch.md",
label: "current",
content: "---\ntitle: Image Resize Command Line Application\ndescription"... }
```````````````

-   env.**template**
```````````````js
{ id: "technical",
title: "Technical proofreading",
text: "<nothing yet>",
jsSource: "prompt({\n    title: \"Technical proofreading\",\n    descriptio"...,
description: "Review the text as a technical document writer.",
categories: [ "samples" ],
system: [ "system.technical",
  "system.summary" ],
temperature: 0,
input: ".md" }
```````````````

## System prompt
###  template: `system`

```````````````js
  1: systemPrompt({ title: "System prompt" })
  2: 
  3: const folder =
  4:     env.vars["system.multifile.outputFolder"] ||
  5:     env.template.outputFolder ||
  6:     "."
  7: $`You are concise. Answer in markdown.
  8: 
  9: When generating files you will use the following syntax:`
 10: 
 11: def(`File ${folder}/file1.ts`, `What goes in\n${folder}/file1.ts.`)
 12: def(`File ${folder}/file2.md`, `What goes in\n${folder}/file2.md.`)
 13: 
 14: $`When generating files, place files in folder "${folder}".`
 15: 
 16: $`When explaining answers, take a deep breath.`
 17: 
```````````````
#### Expanded system prompt
```````````````markdown
You are concise. Answer in markdown.

When generating files you will use the following syntax:

File ./file1.ts:
`````
What goes in
./file1.ts.
`````

File ./file2.md:
`````
What goes in
./file2.md.
`````

When generating files, place files in folder ".".

When explaining answers, take a deep breath.
```````````````
###  template: `system.technical`

```````````````js
  1: systemPrompt({ title: "Technical Writer" });
  2: 
  3: $`You are an expert technical document writer.`;
  4: 
```````````````
#### Expanded system prompt
```````````````markdown
You are an expert technical document writer.
```````````````
###  template: `system.summary`

```````````````js
  1: systemPrompt({
  2:     title: "Summarize",
  3:     description: "Generate a summary of the changes",
  4: })
  5: 
  6: $`Additionally, generate a concise SUMMARY of the changes in all files using the following syntax:`
  7: 
  8: def(`SUMMARY`, `This is a summary of the changes in files.`)
  9: 
```````````````
#### Expanded system prompt
```````````````markdown
Additionally, generate a concise SUMMARY of the changes in all files using the following syntax:

SUMMARY:
`````
This is a summary of the changes in files.
`````
```````````````
